title: Enterprise Service Bus (ESB)
description: An enterprise service bus (ESB) implements a communication system between mutually interacting software applications in a service-oriented architecture (SOA).
key-ideas: Platform-agnostic; integrate any service in any environment (ideally).
Provides an abstraction layer that receives and handles application messages without the need for individual applications to implement multiple protocols and interfaces.
The ESB is responsible for receiving, translating, and delivering messages from service to service.
Highly related to SOA, typically providing a common software interface in order to route messages between the SOA application services.
Route messages from service to service.
